name: places/ChIJpY9Tg01YwokRCr_aQpDrqgk
formattedAddress: 570 Tenth Avenue, W 42nd St At, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 570 Tenth Avenue, W 42nd St At, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Snug rooms & suites in a hip, stylish hotel featuring a rooftop restaurant & a fitness center.

originalText.text: Great value for the money. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. We had a small window with an amazing view. Housekeeping cleans thoroughly every day. Great location. The only issue we had was that the bathroom is kind of right in the room with glass doors, so there's no privacy. For 2 out of the 4 days, we barely had hot water. It sounds a bit challenging, but I'm still happy with the hotel choice

text.text: Great value for the money. The rooms are small but very clean and modern. We had a small window with an amazing view. Housekeeping cleans thoroughly every day. Great location. The only issue we had was that the bathroom is kind of right in the room with glass doors, so there's no privacy. For 2 out of the 4 days, we barely had hot water. It sounds a bit challenging, but I'm still happy with the hotel choice

originalText.text: Magnificent hotel near Times Square, in Manhattan, New York, with new style and a minimalist design, which make it, very different and special. It let you feel like home. The staff is very polite. Prices and taxes are in the average just like others, but the relationship within quality versus price is optimum. Customers are a mix in general, but there are young people also. It worth it!

text.text: Magnificent hotel near Times Square, in Manhattan, New York, with new style and a minimalist design, which make it, very different and special. It let you feel like home. The staff is very polite. Prices and taxes are in the average just like others, but the relationship within quality versus price is optimum. Customers are a mix in general, but there are young people also. It worth it!

originalText.text:
The Hotel has an excellent location, making it easy to get to most of the tourist attractions visited.
The room is small, but quite comfortable. The tilting bed is a very smart solution for being able to move around the room and watch TV comfortably.
The bathroom with its glass walls is quite peculiar. I missed the curtains in the room, to increase privacy.
The staff was very attentive and the restaurant is very practical. The outdoor tables make the place very beautiful.
It was worth staying at YOTEL.

originalText.text:
Great concept extremely friendly staff, nice location. It wasn't a bad experience from staff they were all great, just a lot of things adding up. Marciano I believe his name was PHENOMENAL ‼️ After having my first issue at self checking with my name and reservation number. So I have to go to the front desk. Then a lot of little things in a room, I see the owner has responded to other reviews to report while we're here but, I will address it in the morning. I did have engineering come once because sockets don't work in the room, there's light switches that you don't know what they go to but they had a different lighting system. They could put the vase plates over the wall and take those switches out. Plugs didn't work close to the bed so I had to keep getting up and going white charging and their known issues because engineering pulled out the blow dryer to show that worked in the plug but, the charger for I phone didn't. The AC can't go under 68° it's winter with the window open and the room is still warmer then we'd like. They don't have fans to offer you. The bed didn't work at all. The towel warmer didn't work and there's other stuff but those are all the things I can think of now. Oh only one USB port was working out of 4, could probably use note friendly details.
(I didn't address it all because, I didn't want to go through the hassle engineering being sent again when I called the second time about the AC and changing rooms and potentially have issues in the other room. Then I would have just been more frustrated)
again great staff ‼️
Oh the shower wall plate spins when you adjust the water. (not sure if it's supposed to)

originalText.text:
If you know what you’re getting, this place is value for the money. I found check-in simple, I only have a roller bag so luggage isn’t a problem for me, and I use public transportation so no car to park. The room is very small, but it’s NYC so I expected that. I only sleep and shower there anyway. Bed was comfortable, TV worked. Signs of wear in places, like the shower ceiling is peeling paint from the moisture. My little window had a great view. One day I tried to shower late like 9:30am and there was no hot water so I advise showering the night before or get up earlier. There was a guy on my floor who was like the housekeeper or something, who was always nice and asked me if my room needed cleaning, or if I was checking out. He was observant, attentive, and helpful.

Summary: For this price and this location there is good value here. If you’re snooty then stay at the Waldorf.
